medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain in the right upper quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with sharp right upper quadrant pain that started today. He had a similar presentation two weeks ago, after which surgery was not performed. The patient reports having nausea and vomiting and denies any fevers or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1) Coronary artery disease (CAD) 2) Hypertension 3) Atrial fibrillation (no Coumadin) 4) Pernicious anemia 5) Depression
medical_history.family_history: Paternal family significant for early CAD. Maternal history significant for diabetes and hypertension.
